intro: Cambessedesia membranacea, commonly known as the membranaceous cambessedesia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, papery leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
